triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core technology applied in this paper to generate hardware RTL code.

triples.name: ChatGPT
triples.relevance: ChatGPT is cited as the inspiration for exploring LLM adoption in hardware design.

triples.name: GPT-3
triples.relevance: GPT-3.5 is evaluated in the paper and serves as the baseline LLM for benchmark comparison.

triples.name: Register transfer language
triples.relevance: RTL is the hardware design language that the paper targets for LLM generation.

triples.name: Prompt engineering
triples.relevance: Prompt engineering is the fundamental technique used to structure instructions for LLMs in hardware design.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: NLP is the foundational field enabling LLMs to process natural-language instructions for design tasks.

triples.name: Hardware architecture
triples.relevance: Hardware architecture design is the target application domain for automated RTL generation.

triples.name: Language model benchmark
triples.relevance: The paper proposes RTLLM, a novel benchmark for systematically evaluating LLM-based RTL generation.

triples.name: Code generation
triples.relevance: The paper addresses automated RTL code generation using LLMs with a self-planning technique to improve generation quality.
